results.name: Number of tripling steps to reach 1 in '3x+1' problem, or -1 if 1 is never reached.
comment: A075680, which gives the values for odd n, isolates the essential behavior of this sequence. - _T. D. Noe_, Jun 01 2006
A033959 and A033958 give record values and where they occur. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 08 2014
a(n*2^k) = a(n), for all k >= 0. - _L. Edson Jeffery_, Aug 11 2014

Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
formula: a(1) = 0, a(n) = a(n/2) if n is even, a(n) = a(3n+1)+1 if n>1 is odd. The Collatz conjecture is that this defines a(n) for all n >= 1.
program: a006667 = length . filter odd . takeWhile (> 2) . (iterate a006370)
